alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 21 at 2:09PM PDT until May 26 at 12:58PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.7 feet, Water begins to impact State Route 21 near Little Goosemus Road at mile post 185. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM PDT Sunday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 19.7 feet Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.7 feet on 06/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 600 AM PDT.
